Name: Eden-Class Babylonia
Desc:
Filled with the unprecedented aspirations of humanity, Babylonia was supposed to be the first-ever superluminal starship for interstellar colonization.
Its massive construction alone has ushered in a new era of human history, the Golden Age, where human beings stayed united and evolved.
After the virus outbreak, the construction of Babylonia was forcibly terminated. Babylonia became the shelter for many survivors who had escaped to space.
Now, Babylonia is anchored in the arc orbital dock and, as the starting point for taking back Earth, it maintains close ties with ground forces.

Name: Commercial Square
Desc: A massive commercial property developed under the initiative of Babylonia Commercial Council, serving as a landmark building of the Commercial District.\nThe Commercial Square integrates diverse business formats with rich functionality, meeting people's varied needs for daily shopping, social gatherings, business negotiations, and leisure entertainment.

Name: Commercial Square
Desc: A massive commercial property developed under the initiative of Babylonia Commercial Council, serving as a landmark building of the Commercial District.\nThe Commercial Square integrates diverse business formats with rich functionality, meeting people's varied needs for daily shopping, social gatherings, business negotiations, and leisure entertainment.

Name: Stella Brew
Desc: A comprehensive leisure venue located within the Commercial District, renowned for its exquisite mixed drinks.\nThe menu covers various classic specialty drinks and flavored beverages, catering to the tastes of all customers.\nPerfect for both enjoying quiet moments alone and spending time with friends, Stella Brew attracts numerous customers from Babylonia with its quality drinks at affordable prices and perfectly balanced relaxed atmosphere.

Name: Kuroro Coffee
Desc: A popular coffee shop in the Commercial District, operated by Ross, an owner with extensive professional experience.\nKuroro Coffee features a minimalist and practical layout design, divided into bar seating and general seating areas.\nThe cafe is equipped with standardized coffee-making equipment, capable of providing various types of coffee along with rich seasonings to meet customers' personalized needs.

Name: Orbital Corridor
Desc: A commercial street that brings together various types of shops, including food shops, clothing shops, and more.\nAs an important component of the Commercial District, Orbital Corridor provides residents with a convenient shopping option.

Name: Sequence Square
Desc: An outdoor public space located in the Residential District, serving as one of the important links connecting to the Commercial District.\nDue to its convenient location, Sequence Square serves as both a place for residents' daily leisure activities and a landmark with heavy foot traffic.

Name: Sequence Square
Desc: An outdoor public space located in the Residential District, serving as one of the important links connecting to the Commercial District.\nDue to its convenient location, Sequence Square serves as both a place for residents' daily leisure activities and a landmark with heavy foot traffic.

Name: Commandant's Lounge
Desc: An exclusive lounge Babylonia prepared for the Commandant.\nThe room is equipped with comprehensive home facilities and necessary office equipment.\nThese ensure the Commandant can get adequate rest during downtime between missions while also enabling rapid handling of affairs and issuing of orders when emergencies arise.

Name: "Dreamweaver World"
Desc: A land of blooming pink mountain flowers, beaches, ocean, brilliant seaside fireworks...\nThe Dreamweaver World device constructed this ideal dreamscape for the Commandant and Lucia based on keywords they provided.

Name: Babylonia Commercial District
Desc: "Plazas, cinemas, shopping arcades, and crowds of people... they used to be everywhere on Earth during the Golden Age. Now, this place stands as the last echo of that past prosperity.\n...Is it meaningless? No, I don't believe so. People need moments to rest, and to remember. To understand what we once lost, and what we're still fighting with all our strength to take back."\n— Babylonia Commercial District: 10th Anniversary Feature Interview

Name: Babylonia District Overview
Desc:
"Architecture begins with a question and ends in the search for an answer. Babylonia, this immense man-made structure flying in Earth's orbit, stands as an ever-evolving response from architects to the challenge of survival in the wake of the Punishing crisis.
The distinct sectors we see today—divided by function yet diverse in form—transcend both time and culture. Their overlapping styles faithfully mirror the circumstances our predecessors faced, and the solutions they dared to attempt.
This book is written to guide those who come after us, so they may walk this long path and discover their own answers. And above all, let us remember this: it is humanity's love and hope for its home that architecture was always meant to carry."
— Preface to Introduction to Architecture in the Post-Pandemic Age
